Detailed Description

Provides an abstraction of a DBus Connection.

A DBUS connection is a dedicated link between two applications that wish to exchange DBUS messages. DBus connections can be either private (which is not supported at the moment), or be connections to a bus, which is in charge of routing messages to the right process.

A DBus Connection is needed to instantiate ObjectProxy objects.

The simplest way to have a connection to a bus is through a call to Connection::systemBus or Connection::sessionBus

To be able to process signals, the connection must be associated with an event loop. An event loop must be provided either:

  • before any call to Connection::Connection, Connection::systemBus or Connection::sessionBus, using Connection::useEventLoop static member.
  • during object construction, through the use of the alternate Connection(DBusBusType bustype, const EventLoopIntegration& eventLoop) constructor

If no signals are to be received, then event loop association remains optionnal.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

dbustl::Connection::Connection ( DBusBusType  busType  )  [explicit]

Creates a new dedicated connection on the given bus.

If Connection::useMainLoop has been called beforehand, this connection is associated with the provided mainloop. Otherwise this connection is not associated with any main loop.

In case exceptions are not enabled, check if the connection creation has succeeded by calling isConnected().

Parameters:
busType one of {DBUS_BUS_SYSTEM, DBUS_BUS_SESSION}
Exceptions:
DBusException if something prevents us from getting on the bus

dbustl::Connection::Connection ( DBusBusType  busType,
const EventLoopIntegration &  eventLoop 
)

Creates a new dedicated connection on the given bus, specifying in which main loop to process received messages.

In case exceptions are not enabled, check if the connection creation has succeeded by calling isConnected().

Exceptions:
DBusException if something prevents us from getting on the bus

dbustl::Connection::~Connection (  ) 

Destructor.

The destructor is non virtual on purpose, this class is not designed for inheritance.

Member Function Documentation

Connection * dbustl::Connection::systemBus (  )  [static]

Returns a singleton to the system bus.

If Connection::useMainLoop has been called beforehand, this connection is associated with the provided mainloop. Otherwise this connection is not associated with any main loop.

Do not destroy it, it will be automatically freed at program shutdown.

In case exceptions are not enabled, check if the connection creation has succeeded by calling isConnected().

Exceptions:
DBusException if something prevents us from getting on the system bus

Connection * dbustl::Connection::sessionBus (  )  [static]

Returns a singleton to the session bus.

If Connection::useMainLoop has been called beforehand, this connection is associated with the provided mainloop. Otherwise this connection is not associated with any main loop.

Do not destroy it, it will be automatically freed at program shutdown.

In case exceptions are not enabled, check if the connection creation has succeeded by calling isConnected().

Exceptions:
DBusException if something prevents us from getting on the session bus

void dbustl::Connection::useEventLoop ( const EventLoopIntegration &  eventloop  )  [static]

Specifies the Main Loop (Glib, Qt, any other) in which to integrate the newly created connections.

It is safe to call it more than once.

bool dbustl::Connection::isPrivate (  )  [inline]

If True, means the connection is not on a bus, but is private between two applications.

bool dbustl::Connection::isConnected (  )  [inline]

Tells if we are currently connected to a remote party, either bus or private connection.

DBusConnection * dbustl::Connection::dbus (  ) 

The DBUS C api structure: don't use it!

You should only use it if you really know what you are doing.
